question_text: What is the difference between burn-in on CRT monitors versus image sticking on LCD monitors?
answer_options: CRT burn-in is permanent phosphor damage; LCD image sticking may be temporary and removable
LCD burn-in is worse than CRT burn-in and cannot be fixed
CRT and LCD burn-in are identical problems with the same solutions
Only CRT monitors experience burn-in; LCD monitors never have this issue
correct_answer: CRT burn-in is permanent phosphor damage; LCD image sticking may be temporary and removable
explanation: CRT burn-in was permanent damage to phosphor coatings from static images. LCD 'image sticking' is similar ghosting but may be temporary - displaying different content (like a white screen overnight) can sometimes remove the stuck image from LCD panels.
